results.title: The Discovery of Fingercillin
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas, Robert Maxwell, Joseph E. Levine, Anroste Films and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “DoDo: the kid from outer space”.
DoDo is a kid with extraordinary powers, and he knows how to use them. When he arrives on earth, DoDo has a series of adventures with Compy the Computer Bird and Professor Fingers, who can invent anything. From Hollywood to Loch Ness, from the Pyramids to Paris, DoDo and his pals have fun at the movies, help Interpol capture some spies, find sunken treasure, visit a rodeo and still have time to keep the world from being sold. In this episode Professor Fingers, wanting to become famous, discovers a new antibiotic which will hopefully cure an Arabian sheik’s only son who has been ill for over a year with a mysterious disease. DoDo and the Professor travel to Arabia with the cure and are rewarded for their work. Animated by Harold Whitaker, John Smith, Tony Whitehouse, Tony Guy, Bruno Bozzetto, Arthur Humberstone.

results.title: The Discoverers
results.brief_description: A look at several scientific discoveries and techniques and their implications for the future of humanity - the laser, the fuel cell, urethane foam, the petrochemicals, cross-pollination of technologies, a jet piercing drill and micro-circuitry.
results.description: A look at several scientific discoveries and techniques and their implications for the future of humanity - the laser, the fuel cell, urethane foam, the petrochemicals, cross-pollination of technologies, a jet piercing drill and micro-circuitry.

results.title: The Disco years
results.creator_credit: RLK Productions, Robert Lee King, John Peter James and Richard Hoffman
results.brief_description: Tom is in his final year of High School, desperately fighting against his attraction for the athletic Matt. In the overtly homophobic environment of school there is no-one Tom can talk to about his sexuality. Except, maybe, for the new teacher Mr. Reece? This bittersweet short film is a very funny and very poignant story about coming out as gay in the late seventies, in the disco years, where liberation began on the dancefloor. With Matt Nolan and Dennis Christopher.

results.title: The Directors
results.brief_description: A ‘Life Magazine’ reporter attempts to analyse the traits of a good director, talking to such noted directors as David Lean, Igmar Bergman, Kurosawa, Fellini and Hitchcock. Discusses the evolution of neo-realism, the technical advances that have brought about cinema verite and the New Wave directors and their influence.

results.title: The Director and the film: David Lean
results.brief_description: David Lean in a discussion with actress Maureen Pryor, comments on the aims and techniques he used in ‘The Sound Barrier’, ‘Brief Encounter’, ‘Bridge on the River Kwai’ and ‘Summer Madness’. (nb: A black and white film except for the extract from ‘Summer madness’ which is colour)

results.title: The Director [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Patrick Hughes
results.brief_description: An ex crew member in witness protection recalls what it was like to work for “Jack” - the eponymous director of the title. The finely tuned professional outfit that is “the crew”, arrive at the Western Bank for a shoot, centred around the director, a man who wields awesome power and will do anything for the sake of realism and reaping the benefits at the box office.

results.title: The Director
results.brief_description: Director Don Weis bears the responsibility of supervising every aspect of putting a film together. His talent must encompass acting, camera work, special effects, music, costumes, make-up, scripts, editing and budgeting. This film places the viewer beside a skilful director as he gives shape to a major Hollywood production. Features Robert Wagner in acting role.

results.title: The Diploma Disease (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Institute of Development Studies, Angela Little and Ron Dore
results.brief_description: Educational credentials are increasingly required by employees and so education gives way to ritualised preparation for exams. The ideals of education are powerless against the pressure on schools in societies which have caught the “diploma disease”. Examines symptoms in Japan, Mexico, Sri Lanka, and Britain

results.title: The Diode: principles and applications
results.brief_description: Explains the principles of electron flow across a gap, basic features of the diode tube, control of the electron flow in the tube, photoelectric cells, x-ray tubes, and the diode as a rectifier.
results.description: Explains the principles of electron flow across a gap, basic features of the diode tube, control of the electron flow in the tube, photoelectric cells, x-ray tubes, and the diode as a rectifier.
